snippet: In Hungary, Macedonia, Serbia and elsewhere, special efforts have been imposed to move migrants quickly to border areas.
abstract: Announcement of tougher controls at German, Austrian, Slovakian and the Netherlandic borders is latest obstacle for thousands seeking relief from Middle Eastern and African conflicts and leaves them weighing alternatives; declaration also spurs Hungary, Serbia, Macedonia and other countries to move migrants through as quickly as possible to avoid getting stuck with them.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Palko Karasz from Budapest; Helene Bienvenu from Roszke, Hungary; Miroslava Germanova from Bratislava, Slovakia; Matthew Brunwasser from Belgrade, Serbia; Boryana Dzhambazova from Edirne, Turkey; Kimberly Bradley from Vienna; Aleksandar Dimishkovski from Skopje, Macedonia; and Emmarie Huetteman and Katarina Johannsen from Passau, Germany.

lead_paragraph: In Hungary, Macedonia, Serbia and elsewhere, special efforts have been imposed to move migrants quickly to border areas.

headline.main: With Some Paths Shut, Migrants Seek Others
headline.print_headline: With Some Paths Shut, Migrants Seek Others

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
